page.title: 04HAILSHAM CATTLE MARKET 2
page.content:
At the{Cattle Market}bidding is done in 50p's, Â£1's and Â£5's.The{auctioneer stands in between the pens and starts off with the farmers bidding price. Each farmer has his own signal to say "yes" to the bid; one farmer gave a puff of his cigarette. Others use a blink of the eye, a twitch of a finger and a raise of the hand.
The auctioneer has to ring a bell to let the farmers know that the next item is about to start.When all the people are ready he starts to bid.He talks very quickly and usually repeats the price over and over again.
A man from the Ministry of Agriculture decides if each animal is healthy. If not, it is taken away for slaughter.
